New Records: Malik Monk led the way with a game-high 31 points
Devin Carter made his debut in the first quarter, and showcased his defensive intensity, a knack for rebounding the ball, and a nice ability to push the fastbreak himself
Key Match Events: The Kings came out and played with a pace and energy that I hadn’t seen from this team since that first Beam Team year
Trey Lyles came in and hit three triples of his own in the first quarter
DeMar DeRozan hit a three off a nice dish from Keon Ellis to put the Kings back up 4
Malik Monk decided to take over and hit a three, then took it right to the rim to put the Kings up 123-116
Devin Carter grabbed multiple boards over bigger defenders, and he had a particularly nice possession where he snatched the rebound and pushed the pace and found Alex Len for an easy dunk at the rim
Pre-Game Insights: Coach Christie mentioned that he wanted the Kings to shoot at least 40 threes a game
The Kings will look to extend their winning streak on Sunday as they’ll face the Golden State Warriors in San Francisco for the first time this season
Post-Match Reflections: The Kings put together one of their best offensive performances of the season as they took down the Memphis Grizzlies 138-133 for their third straight win
This was a team that played with joy and leaned into their strengths from start to finish
Hopefully the Kings can carry this momentum forward and resurrect what had seemed to be a dead season
Miscellaneous Highlights: The game had turned into a slugfest, and the Kings were getting a bit frustrated at the lack of calls on their end while Memphis would get to the line on the other end
Devin Carter’s debut was a fine effort for a rookie who hadn’t played much in 6 months
Trey Lyles continues to play very well off the bench
Others: The Kings will face the Golden State Warriors in San Francisco for the first time this season
Devin Carter’s rebounding and defensive intensity were notable in his limited minutes
Keon Ellis is a dynamic defender who disrupts passing lanes, drives, and shots with his long arms
DeMar DeRozan’s 4th three of the night on 7 attempts was a season-high
